headers.subject: [tosdr:2433] Skype has a very broad copyright license

html:
if, at any time you choose to upload or post User Submissions to the Skype Websites or through the Software (excluding Reports and excluding the content of your communications) you automatically grant Skype a non-exclusive, worldwide, irrevocable, royalty-free, perpetual, sub-licensable and transferable license of all rights to use, edit, modify, include, incorporate, adapt, record, publicly perform, display, transmit and reproduce the User Submissions including, without limitation, all trade marks associated therewith, in connection with the Skype Websites and Skype’s Software and Products including for the purpose of promoting or redistributing part or all of the Skype Websites and/or the Software or Products, in any and all media now known or hereafter devised. You also hereby grant each user of the Skype Website and/or Skype’s Software or Products a non-exclusive license to access your User Submission through the Skype Website and/or Software or Products and to use, copy, distribute, prepare derivative works of, display, perform and transmit such User Submissions solely as permitted through the functionality of the Skype Websites and/or Software or Products and pursuant to these Terms of Use. In addition, you waive any so-called “moral rights” in and to the User Submissions, to the extent permitted by applicable law.

http://www.skype.com/en/legal/tou/

I fail to see how such a broad copyright license is necessary to operate the service. Surely it could be reduced in scope.

Title: Very broad copyright license

Topic: copyright-scope

Summary: You grant Skype a very broad copyright license to use any content that you upload, without compensation. This license is a non-exclusive, royalty-free, irrevocable, worldwide, perpetual, sub-licensable and transferable license of the rights to use your content. This goes beyond the scope necessary to operate the service itself.

Score: 100 (mediocre)

--

subject: Skype has a very broad copyright license
text:
>
> if, at any time you choose to upload or post User Submissions to the Skype 
> Websites or through the Software (excluding Reports and excluding the 
> content of your communications) you automatically grant Skype a 
> non-exclusive, worldwide, irrevocable, royalty-free, perpetual, 
> sub-licensable and transferable license of all rights to use, edit, modify, 
> include, incorporate, adapt, record, publicly perform, display, transmit 
> and reproduce the User Submissions including, without limitation, all trade 
> marks associated therewith, in connection with the Skype Websites and 
> Skype’s Software and Products including for the purpose of promoting or 
> redistributing part or all of the Skype Websites and/or the Software or 
> Products, in any and all media now known or hereafter devised. You also 
> hereby grant each user of the Skype Website and/or Skype’s Software or 
> Products a non-exclusive license to access your User Submission through the 
> Skype Website and/or Software or Products and to use, copy, distribute, 
> prepare derivative works of, display, perform and transmit such User 
> Submissions solely as permitted through the functionality of the Skype 
> Websites and/or Software or Products and pursuant to these Terms of Use. In 
> addition, you waive any so-called “moral rights” in and to the User 
> Submissions, to the extent permitted by applicable law.


http://www.skype.com/en/legal/tou/

I fail to see how such a broad copyright license is necessary to operate 
the service. Surely it could be reduced in scope.
